info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 16 at 6:52PM EDT until July 16 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NELSON AND SOUTHWESTERN ALBEMARLE COUNTIES... At 652 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Wintergreen, or 14 miles south of Waynesboro, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Schuyler, Wintergreen, Nellysford, Esmont, Lovingston, Greenfield, Damon, Covesville, Rockfish and Faber. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
